ThingDef.label: fishing rod
ThingDef.description: A simple fishing rod made of wood. With some patience, you can catch fishes with it.

ThingDef.label: jumpsuit
ThingDef.description: A basic Jumpsuit. Normally seen worn on Glitterworld light infantry and officials and especially firefighters for it's heat absorbing properties

ThingDef.label: overalls
ThingDef.description: Spaceship engineers all across the galaxy are known to wear these for the resistance they provide against their worst enemy: The electric cables.

ThingDef.label: standard issue overalls
ThingDef.description: Standard military issue air force overalls. Very common amongst orbital drop squads

ThingDef.label: Tunic
ThingDef.description: Very sleek and skillfully crafted suit capable of protecting the wearer from formidable threats.

ThingDef.label: padded vest
ThingDef.description: Crude Leather padding for added protection against blunt damage.

ThingDef.label: Trader's coat
ThingDef.description: What is a trader? A miserable little pile of bags -Count Dravania, moments before being lynched by an angry mob.

ThingDef.label: longcoat
ThingDef.description: Very, very warm and majestic.

ThingDef.label: Brocade vest
ThingDef.description: Always keep calm and collected. And wear brocade. The definite go to piece of apparel for any gentleguy or gal

ThingDef.label: Joywirer's brocade
ThingDef.description: All the joywire artists wearing these know how to talk to their clients or at the very least, give the impression that they'd know what the heck they are doing.

ThingDef.label: mesh shirt
ThingDef.description: All the punks felt lucky wearing these.

ThingDef.label: bib apron
ThingDef.description: These kind of hardened leather aprons are used by professionals of many trades.

ThingDef.label: cooking apron
ThingDef.description: Pocketed cloth apron intended for enhancing your housekeeping experience. It's a hygiene thing, you wouldn't understand.

ThingDef.label: Surgeon's apron
ThingDef.description: Lovely plastic apron for all your bloodspilling needs.

ThingDef.label: ammo belt
ThingDef.description: Belt designed for carrying ammunition.
Gunslinger's second best friend, Right after the sixshooter and Ten-Gallon Stetson! No, wait make that the third best.
ThingDef.label: poncho

ThingDef.description: Ceremonial shoulderguard
ThingDef.label: Tribal shoulderpads

ThingDef.description: Shield made of planks and padding. Used by native tribes in hopes to deflect bullets and to summon the courage of the great 'Shiled-Sheild TÃ©h Gaurdian' A Godly protector of the tribes.
ThingDef.label: Tribal shield

ThingDef.description: Shoulderpads cobbled together from urban scraps. Sometimes even leather
ThingDef.label: shoulderpads
raider jacket
ThingDef.description: Your basic jacket modified with crude shoulderpads and spikes.

Captain's uniform jacket. Gives the wearer very commanding presence. Most often seen on Starfleet admirals. Commanders wearing garments like these would only need to say "Make it so" and all the tachyon colliders would be rerouted to the shields to withstand the devastating blast no other ships could even hope to survive
ThingDef.label: uniform coat
pants
ThingDef.description: A simple set of pants.

ThingDef.label: Urban trousers
ThingDef.description: Trousers with suspenders, leave them hanging for that urban look

ThingDef.label: stablehand trousers
ThingDef.description: Ain't a chap on earf lookin' as honest as one wearin' these. With these equipped one should feel more comfortable wading through mud and filth and therefore more inclined to get the job done without distractions

ThingDef.label: padded pants
ThingDef.description: Pair of pants with extra padding in key locations.

ThingDef.label: Spacemarine leggings
ThingDef.description: Highly advanced plasteel leggings

ThingDef.label: Enviro-leggings
ThingDef.description: High quality and adapts well to temperature changes. Ideal for space exploration

ThingDef.label: chaps
ThingDef.description: Chaps with holsters. All the fastest shots wore these. They usually got shot in the back. Tinkle winkle moonshine, probably should wear some pants with these.

ThingDef.label: waistcloth
ThingDef.description: Waistcloth. They itch a little.

ThingDef.label: fancy pants
ThingDef.description: They're very stylish.

ThingDef.label: patch pants
ThingDef.description: very crude and ugly pair of pants.

ThingDef.label: Constructor's trousers
ThingDef.description: Trousers with huge pocket space. They help weakened beings to carry more.

ThingDef.label: jeans
ThingDef.description: Sturdy farmer pants.

ThingDef.label: jodhpurs
ThingDef.description: Very commanding.

ThingDef.label: skirt
ThingDef.description: For when your legs need all that extra space.

ThingDef.label: leather pants
ThingDef.description: Leather pants (sometimes even real leather!) The punk wearing these will always feel lucky.

ThingDef.label: checkered trousers
ThingDef.description: Checkered and ready to go!.

ThingDef.label: Tunica El MÃ³go
ThingDef.description: Ritual vestments of the ancient, now extinct tribe - ChÃ©w Ãn Tuna SÃ£mmich - El MÃ³go for short. The El MÃ³goan Muffalo Prophets' prophecied of a day when three meteors, bearing sleeping gods would descent from the skies. Common belief was that the gods would build a lift to the spirit realms. These vestments were created in the intent of binding the soul of slain gods to the wearer and thus gaining passage on the lift.
Shoulderpads cobbled together from metal scraps. All painted and ready for action!
ThingDef.label: Metal shoulderpads
alloy vest
ThingDef.description: Standard issue protective vest on the glitterworlds. Made of multiple layers of extremely light but strong alloy.

ThingDef.label: light power armor
ThingDef.description: Powered light armor, fashioned after the infamous Light power armor mark IV which comes with attached GlitOrionÂ© hip'n'hopâ¢ thrusters, which enables slightly faster movement.

ThingDef.label: Medic's powered armor
ThingDef.description: Powered medium armor, designed for combat medics. Comes with attached GlitOrionÂ© hip'n'hopâ¢ thrusters and StimulantPakâ¢ for faster mobility and healing

ThingDef.label: Shielded coat
ThingDef.description: A long coat with bullet resistant alloy breastplate, fitted with personal shield. Modern technology full of grit

ThingDef.label: Wanderer's chestplate
ThingDef.description: Lone wanderers would wear something like this while on their noble crusade or vendetta.

ThingDef.label: Prototype scyther frame
ThingDef.description: Mobility enhancing wireframe based on inner workings of a mechanoid 'scyther' unit. Warning! Due to awkward adaptation to human bodystructure long usage may cause major muscle strains. Wearer may be rendered susceptible to unwanted side-effects. Including but not limited to: Complete loss of motor functions, Motion sickness, and nose bleed.

ThingDef.label: Prototype hive armor
ThingDef.description: Fashioned after the centipede bodystructure. This extremely bulky armor is nigh indestructable. The Sheer weight of this piece of armor drastically hinders mobility

ThingDef.label: Prototype Steamhull
ThingDef.description: Combination of mobility enhancing components of the Scyther frame and heavy plating of the Hive armor. The increased energy consumption from the added scyther frame servos, have forced the shock dampeners work on lesser capacity, thus rendering the wearer more vulnerable to injuries but the higher mobility under combat situations are well worth it. Generates absurd amounts of heat though.
